fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: ISO/IEC 14496-2:2004. Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 2: Visual. Core Profile (formal name); MPEG-4, Visual Coding, Core Profile (common name)

fdd:description.p: See also MP4_FF_2 and MPEG-4_V. This profile is useful in higher-quality interactive services and supports mobile broadcast services.
The Core Profile permits the use of the following visual object types:

ul.li: Simple: rectangular video, uses intra (I) and predicted (P) video object planes (VOPs, the MPEG-4 term for frames).

Core: arbitrarily shaped video, uses a tool superset of Simple, adds bidirectional (B) video object planes (VOPs), binary shape coding, and supports temporal scalability based on sending extra P-VOPs.

fdd:description.p: Two compression levels are permitted; Levels 1 (maximum bit rate 384 kbps) and 2 (maximum 2 Mbps). Uses typical session size depending upon level: Quarter Common Intermediate Format (QCIF; 176 pixels by 144 lines, 30 fps; 1.22:1) or Common Intermediate Format (CIF; 352 pixels by 288 lines, 30 fps; 1.22:1).

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: MPEG-4 video encoding useful in higher-quality interactive services and supports mobile broadcast services.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: MPEG-4 File Format, V.2, with Visual Coding (All Profiles)

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Actual adoption not known to the compilers of this document.

fdd:movingImageQF.fdd:clarity: See MPEG-4 and MPEG-4_V. Potential for greater clarity at a given picture size, data rate, and encoding algorithm, than some other MPEG-4 profiles, e.g., Simple and Simple Scalable Profiles. May offer slightly less clarity at a given picture size, data rate, and encoding algorithm than the Main Profile.

fdd:other.fdd:tag: File type brand (ISO Base Media File Format)

fdd:values.fdd:note: Indicated in file wrapper and relates to "brands" defined in ISO_BMFF. Wrapping MPEG-4_V bitstreams in MP4_FF_1 would occasion the use of mp41; in MP4_FF_2, use mp42. See Part 15 of the standard, pp. 2-9, 13.

fdd:values.fdd:note: Indicators for Core Profile levels 1 and 2 are 00100001, 00100010, respectively. From Annex G of ISO/IEC 14496-2:2004, Table G.1
